doc.previous: This is called the expected utility theorem. The required assumptions are four axioms about the properties of the agent's preference relation over 'simple lotteries', which are lotteries with just two options. Writing to mean 'A is weakly preferred to B' ('A is preferred at least as much as B'), the axioms are:
doc.after: Axioms 3 and 4 enable us to decide about the relative utilities of two assets or lotteries.
